means: 采( pick的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was hand-picked for this job by the Admiral.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是由海军上将精心挑选出来担任这项工作的。

sentence.Network_en: I picked first all the people who usually were left till last.
sentence.Network_cn: 我先挑出了所有通常留到最后的人。

sentence.Network_en: They've picked up a really nasty infection from something they've eaten.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们因吃错东西而得了很严重的感染症。

entry.def: If you pick a particular person or thing, you choose that one.

example.ex: Mr Nowell had picked ten people to interview for six sales jobs in London...
example.tran: 诺埃尔先生为伦敦的6个销售职位选出了10人进行面试。

example.ex: I had deliberately picked a city with a tropical climate.
example.tran: 我特意选了一个热带气候的城市。

entry.def: You can refer to the best things or people in a particular group as the pick of that group.

example.ex: The boys here are the pick of the under-15 cricketers in the country...
example.tran: 这儿的男孩是全国15岁以下板球手中的佼佼者。

example.ex: We had the pick of suits from the shop.
example.tran: 我们买了店里最好的套装。

entry.def: When you pick flowers, fruit, or leaves, you break them off the plant or tree and collect them.

example.ex: She used to pick flowers in the Cromwell Road...
example.tran: 她过去常到克伦威尔路采花。

example.ex: He helps his mother pick fruit.
example.tran: 他帮母亲摘果子。

entry.def: If you pick something from a place, you remove it from there with your fingers or your hand.

example.ex: He picked the napkin from his lap and placed it alongside his plate...
example.tran: 他拿起腿上的餐巾，放在盘子旁边。

example.ex: He picked the telephone off the wall bracket.
example.tran: 他从墙上的固定托架上摘下电话。

entry.def: If you pick your nose or teeth, you remove substances from inside your nose or between your teeth.

example.ex: Edgar, don't pick your nose, dear...
example.tran: 埃德加，不要抠鼻子，宝贝儿。

example.ex: He had just had a meal and was picking his teeth after it.
example.tran: 他刚吃完饭，正在剔牙。

entry.tran: 寻找…的口实；寻（衅）；找（碴儿）
entry.def: If you pick a fight or quarrel with someone, you deliberately cause one.

example.ex: He picked a fight with a waiter and landed in jail...
example.tran: 他找碴儿跟服务生打了一架，最后进了监狱。

example.ex: He was clearly in a mood to pick a quarrel with anybody.
example.tran: 他现在的心情明显是逮谁就想跟谁吵。

entry.def: If someone such as a thief picks a lock, they open it without a key, for example by using a piece of wire.

example.ex: He picked each lock deftly, and rifled the papers within each drawer.
example.tran: 他熟练地撬开每一把锁，把每个抽屉里的文件都偷走了。

entry.def: A pick is the same as a pickaxe .

entry.tran: 挑挑拣拣；挑三拣四；挑剔
entry.def: If you pick and choose, you carefully choose only things that you really want and reject the others.

example.ex: As a vocational teacher I could pretty much pick and choose my work...
example.tran: 作为一名职业教师，我几乎可以随意挑拣自己的工作。

example.ex: We, the patients, cannot pick and choose our doctors.
example.tran: 我们患者不能对医生挑挑拣拣。

entry.def: If you have your pick of a group of things, you are able to choose any of them that you want.

example.ex: Here is an actress who could have her pick of any part...
example.tran: 这是一个角色任她挑选的女演员。

example.ex: Klein could have had his pick of the world's top models.
example.tran: 克莱恩本可以从世界顶尖模特中想选谁就选谁。

entry.def: If you are told to take your pick, you can choose any one that you like from a group of things.

example.ex: Accountants can take their pick of company cars...
example.tran: 会计师可以任选配备的公车。

example.ex: Take your pick from ten luxury hotels...
example.tran: 10家豪华宾馆任你选择。

entry.def: If you pick your way across an area, you walk across it very carefully in order to avoid obstacles or dangerous things.

example.ex: The girls were afraid of snakes and picked their way along with extreme caution...
example.tran: 女孩们害怕蛇，于是谨小慎微地择路而行。

example.ex: I moved away from the shack and picked my way among the rubble.
example.tran: 我离开木屋，小心地走在瓦砾间。

entry.tran: 收拾残局；努力恢复正常
entry.def: When you pick up the pieces after a disaster, you do what you can to get the situation back to normal again.

example.ex: Do we try and prevent problems or do we try and pick up the pieces afterwards?...
example.tran: 我们是想要防患未然呢，还是想要事后收拾残局？

example.ex: She died, and somehow I never picked up the pieces and started again.
example.tran: 她死后我竟一蹶不振，无法重新来过。

entry.def: When a vehicle picks up speed, it begins to move more quickly.

example.ex: Brian pulled away slowly, but picked up speed.
example.tran: 布赖恩慢慢开动汽车，但很快就加速了。

auth_sentence.content: This has also been picked up by Torrent Freak.
auth_sentence.res_content: This has also been picked up by Torrent Freak.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This has also been picked up by Torrent Freak.

auth_sentence.content: The very best fruit is tree-ripened and recently picked.
auth_sentence.res_content: The very best fruit is tree-ripened and recently picked.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The very best fruit is tree-ripened and recently picked.

auth_sentence.content: That report was then picked up around the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: That report was then picked up around the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That report was then picked up around the world.

Sentence.sentence: As rationing came to an end in the 1950s, technology picked up and was used to mass-produce food," Tomes says.
A recent review of California community colleges found that while a third of the Asian students picked up their degrees, only 15% of African-Americans did so as well.
